body_html:
Hm, if a team getting offered 2 conferences is the rarer, more exceptional case, we should probably build things with this as the main scenario in mind and don't treat the comment as such an important part of the whole workflow (especially if it's optional)

So what about this:
We take the first approach (one ConferenceOffer per Conference) at let a Team have 0..* of them (this would also allow to offer 3 conferences, etc.)

Contra: the comment is targeted at a single Conference rather then the "whole offer"

Pro: this is technically speaking already an Attendance and could be a) renamed to have this meaning and b) contain the necessary boolean or whatever to confirm "yes, the team is going".

body:
Hm, if a team getting offered 2 conferences is the rarer, more exceptional case, we should probably build things with this as the main scenario in mind and don't treat the comment as such an important part of the whole workflow _(especially if it's optional)_

So what about this:
We take the first approach (one `ConferenceOffer` per `Conference`)  at let a `Team` have `0..*` of them (this would also allow to offer 3 conferences, etc.)

**Contra:** the comment is targeted at a single `Conference` rather then the "whole offer"

**Pro:** this is technically speaking already an `Attendance` and could be a) renamed to have this meaning and b) contain the necessary boolean or whatever to confirm "yes, the team is going".
